TITLE: Inflation rose 0.4% in April and 4.7% from a year ago, according to key gauge for the Fed
SUMMARY: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.3% in April, according to a Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: A U.S. recession would be 'good news' for markets, strategist says
SUMMARY: A U.S. recession may prevent a steep market downturn in the second half of 2023, according to Michael Yoshikami, founder and CEO of Destination Wealth Management.

TITLE: How the A.I. explosion could save the market and maybe the economy
SUMMARY: Whether it's personalized shopping or self-driving cars, AI will become a factor in virtually everyone's lives.

TITLE: Former Fed Chair Ben Bernanke says there's more work ahead to control inflation
SUMMARY: A research paper notes that inflation has evolved since ballooning to a 40-year high in the summer of 2022.

TITLE: Bank of England governor says the UK is facing a wage-price spiral
SUMMARY: Andrew Bailey said second-round effects of wage growth and price setting were "unlikely to go away as quickly as they appeared."

TITLE: Retail sales rose 0.4% in April, less than expected as consumers struggle with inflation
SUMMARY: Excluding auto-related figures, sales increased 0.4%, which was in line with expectations.

TITLE: Consumer debt passes $17 trillion for the first time despite slide in mortgage demand
SUMMARY: The total for borrowing across all categories hit $17.05 trillion, an increase of nearly $150 billion, or 0.9% during the January-to-March period.

TITLE: Shifting to life post-Covid: How remote work transformed this city in the Midwest
SUMMARY: Lansing, Michigan is one example of how downtowns have attempted to move away from office-centric economies.

TITLE: UK economy grows by 0.1% in the first quarter but inflation continues to weigh
SUMMARY: U.K. gross domestic product figures for March showed a 0.1% growth.

TITLE: Fed Governor Waller casts doubt on need to conduct climate change tests for banks
SUMMARY: Waller on Thursday said that conducting special tests for how banks are preparing for such risks probably shouldn't fall under the Fed's purview.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose just 0.2% in April, less than estimate as inflation pressures ease
SUMMARY: Wholesale prices rose less than expected in April, according to a Labor Department report Thursday.

TITLE: German minister calls for maturity on U.S. debt ceiling talks: 'We have to avoid further risks'
SUMMARY: Time is running out for an agreement, with U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warning earlier this month that without a deal, the largest economy in the world could default by June 1.

TITLE: Yellen says it should be 'unthinkable' for the U.S. to default on its debt
SUMMARY: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen spoke to reporters ahead of the G-7 finance ministers and central bank governors meetings in Niigata, Japan.

TITLE: Covid caused huge shortages in the jobs market. It may be easing — but there's another problem ahead
SUMMARY: Since the onset of Covid-19, labor shortages have plagued major economies and intensified inflationary pressures, but economists expect this trend to finally abate.

TITLE: Traders raise the chances for a Fed rate cut following April inflation report
SUMMARY: Traders on Wednesday raised the chances of a September interest rate cut to close to 80%.

TITLE: Inflation rate eases to 4.9% in April, less than expectations
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to rise 0.4% in April, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Fed's John Williams says rates could be increased if inflation doesn't come down
SUMMARY: The current problems in the banking industry and their impact will factor into Williams' policy outlook.

TITLE: Worries linger about financial stability following bank rescue, Fed report shows
SUMMARY: The Fed last published its Financial Stability Report in November 2022, months before the implosion  of several prominent midsize banks.

TITLE: Fed report shows banks worried about conditions ahead, with focus on slowing economy and deposit outflows
SUMMARY: The Senior Loan Officer Opinion survey said requirements got tougher for commercial and industrial loans as well as for many household-debt instruments.

TITLE: Outlook for household spending slumped in April, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: The central bank Survey of Consumer Expectations for April showed that the outlook for spending fell by half a percentage point to an annual rate of 5.2%.

TITLE: Unemployment rate sinks in April for Black and Hispanic workers, but holds steady for Asians
SUMMARY: April's nonfarm payrolls report beat expectations and the unemployment rate declined across the board.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for April 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: See which sectors gained, and lost, the most jobs in April.

TITLE: Job growth totals 253,000 in April, beating expectations even as the U.S. economy slows
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 180,000 in April, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Private payrolls surged by 296,000 in April, much higher than expected, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private payrolls growth was above the downwardly revised 142,000 the previous month and well ahead of the Dow Jones estimate for 133,000.

TITLE: After First Republic's rescue, economists predict further pain with a 'new era' of higher inflation
SUMMARY: Turmoil in the banking sector means central banks face in increasingly "delicate dance" in their efforts to rein in inflation, World Economic Forum Managing Director Saadia Zahidi told CNBC.

TITLE: Job openings fell more than expected in March to lowest level in nearly two years
SUMMARY: The JOLTS report showed that job vacancies totaled 9.59 million for the month, down from 9.97 million in February.

TITLE: The First Republic deal has come at a crucial point for the markets and economy
SUMMARY: With financial services covering such a wide swath of activities in the $26.5 trillion U.S. economy, the bank failures will reverberate.

TITLE: Key inflation gauge for the Fed rose 0.3% in March as expected
SUMMARY: The personal consumption expenditures price index excluding food and energy increased 0.3% for the month.

TITLE: Euro zone economy ekes out 0.1% growth in first quarter, misses expectations as Germany stagnates
SUMMARY: Euro zone GDP rose slightly in the first three months of the year, but its biggest economy stagnated.

TITLE: IMF warns of 'disorderly' house price corrections in Europe as interest rates move higher
SUMMARY: The IMF said that the European Central Bank needs to be increasing rates until mid-2024 to fight inflation.
